name: #k@
tagline: Hashkat : Kinetic Analysis of Twitter-like networks
body:
![Hashkat](https://github.com/hashkat/hashkat.github.io/blob/master/images/hashKAT.png) ###Description `#k@` is a dynamic network simulation tool designed to model the growth of and information propagation through an online social network. It is an agent-based, Kinetic Monte Carlo engine capable of simulating online networks such as Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc. `#k@` incorporates all elements of online social networks including multiple user profiles (e.g. standard users, organizations, celebrities, and bots), user messaging, trending topics, and advertising. Agents within the network make decisions (e.g. follow, unfollow, broadcast, and rebroadcast) based on a variety of user defined constraints on signal propagation to model language, region, ideology, musical interests, and humour. `#k@` allows for simulation of a realistic online social network, enabling users to test hypotheses for growth mechanisms and scenarios for information propagation. As it solves the forward problem, `#k@` can be used with Big Data analytics tools to test data collection protocols and ensure inverse model validity. `#k@` is a fully cross-platform tool: it works natively on `Windows 10`, `OS X`, and `Linux` platforms. [Download the latest version of Hashkat](https://github.com/hashkat/hashkat/archive/master.zip) *** **Email:** isaac.tamblyn@uoit.ca
**Web:** [http://faculty.uoit.ca/itamblyn](http://faculty.uoit.ca/itamblyn) *** `#k@` was developed by K. Ryczko, A. Domurad, and I. Tamblyn (hosted on github.com) *** ###Documentation `#k@` has built-in documentation web pages. Find detailed information, instructions and tutorials at [docs.hashkat.org](http://docs.hashkat.org/en/latest/)
